title: helm-override-show fails for ingress charts
link:
system helm-override-show ingress openstack fails as detailed below.

The following was performed on a system with kuberentes enabled with a basic config.

[wrsroot@controller-0 ~(keystone_admin)]$ system helm-override-show ingress openstack
Command '['helm', 'install', '--dry-run', '--debug', '--values', '/tmp/tmpwk24EV', '--values', '/tmp/tmpNmucXX', '/tmp/tmpoyyPMd']' returned non-zero exit status 1
/var/log/sysinv.log:2018-08-27 14:54:44.325 4733 ERROR wsme.api [-] Server-side error: "Command '['helm', 'install', '--dry-run', '--debug', '--values', '/tmp/tmpwk24EV', '--values', '/tmp/tmpNmucXX', '/tmp/tmpoyyPMd']' returned non-zero exit status 1". Detail:

controller-0:/home/wrsroot# cat /tmp/tmpwk24EV
{}
controller-0:/home/wrsroot# cat /tmp/tmpNmucXX
controller-0:/home/wrsroot# cat /tmp/tmpoyyPMd
cat: /tmp/tmpoyyPMd: No such file or directory
controller-0:/home/wrsroot# helm install --dry-run --debug --values /tmp/tmpwk24EV --values /tmp/tmpNmucXX /tmp/tmpoyyPMd
[debug] Created tunnel using local port: '49276'

[debug] SERVER: "127.0.0.1:49276"

[debug] Original chart version: ""
Error: path "/tmp/tmpoyyPMd" not found


EDIT:  It looks like the problem is that we're running sysinv-api as the "sysinv" user but in the "root" group.  This prevents it from accessing /etc/kubernetes/admin.conf, which is readable by the "wrs_protected" group and the "root" user.

title: deployment/libvirt: virtual disk placement for reference configurations
link:
Consider moving cluster configuration variables into a cluster configuration script to be given to the setup_${configuration}.sh scripts as parameter or sourced in advance.   Define storage paths and the (virsh) domain's storage path - per domain; so that virtual servers can be allocated on specific resources.  But especially, allow the user to move storage off the root disk.

Ie., Some virtual servers such as controllers may consume 150G, while others such as computes may consume as little as 6G.  And, it may be useful to put the active controller on an idle or faster physical device; while others, such as second controller, storage and computes can suffer to be slowed by contention.

title: deployment/libvirt: tenant networking for reference configurations
link: The current wikis for reference configurations under virtualization end after the cluster's node configurations.  Continue this configuration as it pertains to tenant networking.  In particular, provide reference for setting up external network on the providernet and with routers through which to connect instances on internal networks.

title: deployment/libvirt: concurrent clusters under virtualization
link:
Consider putting cluster configuration variables (domain names, subnets, etc) into a configuration script that is sourced in advance or given as parameter to the setup_${configuration}.sh scripts.  Identify any variables needed to allow clusters to be configured and run without conflict, and put those into the configuration script.

Provide samples of configuration script file for each reference configuration, given that each reference configuration has it's own setup_${configuration}.sh script with specific node and virtual disk counts.  The samples should be self documenting to allow the user to copy/paste and modify.

Estimate resource requirements of StarlingX clusters and cluster nodes to allow users to estimate a virtualization host's capacity to run multiple clusters.  Include disk storage size, load on disk, memory usage, cpu loads

title: Fix exceptions from nova/neutron client access
link:
With the --kubernetes option enabled and native service disabled, we see three exceptions thrown from the conductor when sysinv agent reports the host information the first time.
Catch these as the nova host-aggregate assignment exception is preventing proper agent operation.
